lead_paragraph: Guillermo Canas, sidelined for 15 months because of a doping ban, had brief cause to celebrate yesterday at the Pacific Life Open in Indian Wells, Calif. Canas eased into the second round with a 6-1, 6-1 victory over Jan Hajek, but next faces Roger Federer, the world’s top-ranked player.
